bug.author: quinor
bug.summary: native amp does not work when rewriting the optimizer_step function
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
If one rewrites like suggested in the docs (ie. <denchmark-link:https://pytorch-lightning.readthedocs.io/en/latest/optimizers.html#step-optimizers-at-arbitrary-intervals>https://pytorch-lightning.readthedocs.io/en/latest/optimizers.html#step-optimizers-at-arbitrary-intervals</denchmark-link> ), the native AMP stops working. The issue happens due to the default performing a few native-amp-specific actions (see <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/blob/master/pytorch_lightning/core/lightning.py#L1176>https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/blob/master/pytorch_lightning/core/lightning.py#L1176</denchmark-link> ). Please see this discussion for more detail. <denchmark-link:https://pytorch-lightning.slack.com/archives/CRBLFHY79/p1588930218145400>https://pytorch-lightning.slack.com/archives/CRBLFHY79/p1588930218145400</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
A na√Øve custom optimizer_step should work with native AMP. I'm not sure how to really solve it. The simplest (but pretty bad in my opinion) option is to just write in the docs "If you want to use AMP and custom optimizer_step, add X, Y and Z to your code". <denchmark-h:h3>Additional context</denchmark-h>
The issue only happens on pytorch 1.6+ since that's where the native amp is implemented.
